lines.gurmukhi: jYsy KwNf KwNf khY muiK nhI mITw hoie jb lg jIB s√çwd KwNfu nhIN KweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Khaand Khaand Kahai Moukhi Nahee Meetthaa Hoi , Jab Lag Jeebh Svaad Khaandu Naheen Khaaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as by saying sugar, sugar, one cannot feel sweet taste of sugar in the mouth. Unless sugar is placed on the tongue, it cannot feel its taste.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy rwq AMDyrI mY dIpk dIpk khY iqmr n jweI jb lg n jrweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Raat Andhayree Mai Deepak Deepak Kahai , Timar N Jaaee Jab Lag N Jaraaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: In a dark night, saying lamp, lamp does not dispel darkness unless lamp is lit.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy igAwn igAwn khY igAwn hUM n hoq kCu jb lgu gur igAwn AMqir n pweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Giaan Giaan Kahai Giaan Hoon N Hot Kachhu , Jab Lagu Gur Giaan Antari N Paaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just by saying Gian (Knowledge) again and again, knowledge cannot be obtained. It can only be acquired by lodging His name in the heart.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur iDAwn khY gur iDAwn hU n pwvq jb lgu gur drs jwie n smweIAY ]542]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gur Dhiaan Kahai Gur Dhiaan Hoo N Paavata , Jab Lagu Gur Daras Jaai N Samaaeeai ?542?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly just repeatedly asking for a glimpse of True Guru, one cannot acquire contemplation of the True Guru. This is possible only when one engrosses oneself up to the soul in the ardent desire of a glimpse of the True Guru.  (542)
